item.title: Psyvariar 3 launches March 19, 2026 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Shoot 'em up sequel dated.

Shoot ’em up sequel Psyvariar 3 will launch for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 19, 2026 in Japan, publishers SUCCESS Corporation and Red Art Games, and developer Red Art Studios announced. 

The PlayStation 5 and Switch 2 versions will be priced at 6,380 yen for the standard edition, and 11,880 yen for the limited edition. The Switch version will be priced at 5,280 yen for the standard edition, and 10,780 yen for the limited edition. The limited edition includes a pin set and soundtrack CD.

In the west, Psyvariar 3 will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2026, but a specific release date has yet to be announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Red Art Games:

About

Psyvariar 3 takes place many years after the events of Psyvariar 2. After the fall of ETA, a faction of Psyvariars declared that Earth was too precious to be forsaken. They vowed to reclaim and colonize it once more, with GUIS rising from its ashes to resume its original mission.

Decades pass. The Earth colony thrives. Then… a signal. Alien. Unknown.

The moment Gluon particles are detected, dread spreads like fire. The skies darken with a familiar terror—Earth is under siege once again. The time has come for a new generation of Psyvariars to rise… and save humanity.

Key Features

  • Seven playable characters with unique shot types, buzz and bomb mechanics, and scoring systems.
  • Guest character Cotton from the Cotton series is fully playable with her own ship and abilities.
  • Refined Buzz system that rewards skillful bullet grazing with score boosts and shield chains.
  • Signature roll mechanic updated for modern controllers all the while preserving the original arcade “wiggle” input for extra advantage and fluid movement.
  • Neutrino and shield system that give access to shields, speed boosts, and enhanced weapons by buzzing and shooting.
  • Strategic bomb variations that include short and long types with varying effects depending on the character in use.
  • Multiple game modes: Arcade, Arrange, Mission (49 short challenges), Caravan, Endless, and Practice.
  • Dynamic difficulty selection that unlocks harder routes and exclusive boss encounters based on performance.
  • Seven distinct areas and bosses with varied attack patterns depending on the difficulty.
  • Arcade-perfect intensity that preserves the intense, high risk / high reward action the series is known for.
  • Neo-retro 3D aesthetics inspired by early Psyvariar games.

More About Psyvariar

Born in 2000 with the launch of the original Psyvariar: Medium Unit in Japanese Arcades, the Psvyariar series has since then made its mark over the years. Psyvariar 3 is the highly anticipated sequel to the acclaimed vertical shoot ’em up series.

Designed with deep reverence for the franchise by lovers of the genre, Psyvariar 3 is the result of the collaboration between Banana Bytes (Sophstar), Red Art Games, and Red Art Studios, with the blessing of intellectual property holder SUCCESS Corporation. It builds on the franchise’s signature “buzz” mechanic while introducing new characters, refined controls, and a variety of game modes. With its seven unique pilots, each with distinct abilities and scoring systems, it also remains faithful to its arcade roots while delivering enhanced replay value and accessibility for today’s players.

item.title: Dream adventure game Green Light announced for PC, iOS, and Android
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Smartphone

Due out in 2026.

Publisher and developer room6, developer hako life, and singer-songwriter yanaginagi have announced Green Light, an adventure game that lets players experience the world of yanaginagi’s new album of the same name, which is due out on February 28, 2026. The game will launch for PC via Steam, iOS, and Android in 2026 with English and Japanese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“Have you heard about this town?”

“A forgotten mining town with no gemstones left.”

“But at night, all of its people come together. Like in one single, strange dream.”

The hotel’s doors creak again. Midori, green earrings shining as bright as always, is ready to welcome today’s new guests.

This used to be a thriving mining community, but now, with no more gemstones left to take, it’s just a peaceful, boring countryside town.

There’s just one strange rumor going around. Every night, when they go to bed, the townspeople all have one, shared dream. And you know what? It’s a fun, amazing dream too!

Many visit the town just to experience that very dream, and for once, the hotel is getting new business daily. Midori, too, is always curious to learn more about the people who wander in the hotel.

Eventually, that curiosity will lead Midori to discover the secret behind the town.

There must be a reason if everyone is having the same dream at once, right?

If you want to join the receptionist on this adventure… sleep tight.

Watch a teaser trailer below.

item.title: Cho Aniki Collection coming to PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Currently available for Switch.

Edia will release Cho Aniki Collection for PC via Steam for 6,800 yen (7,480 yen with tax), the developer announced. It will support English and Japanese language options. A release date was not announced.

Cho Aniki Collection, which includes Cho Aniki and Ai Cho Aniki, first launched for Switch on December 12, 2024 in Japan, followed by January 29, 2025 worldwide.

Here is an overview of the collection, via its Steam page:

About

The first game in the legendary Cho Aniki series of shooting games created by Masaya, Cho Aniki (PC Engine), and the second game in the series, Ai Cho Aniki (PC Engine), have been fully ported for the Steam.

The ports of these classics boast a number of additional features, such as Sound Mode, Visual Mode, and Rewind.

These titles are an absolute must for retro game and shooting game fans alike.

Cho Aniki (released December 25, 1992)

The Emperor of Planet Builder, who has won the Galactic Bodybuilding Contest for 10 consecutive years, is worried that his planet’s protein is running low.

The Emperor, believing that “muscle is the greatest of virtues,” has begun indiscriminately invading neighboring planets and building protein mining plants on them.

Sensing an impending crisis, Idaten and Benten of the Heavenly World set out on a mission to achieve peace by destroying the Builder Army…

Ai Cho Aniki (released February 24, 1995)

Two years have passed since Idaten and Benten last fought.

After the death of Emperor Roid, peace was restored to the galaxy, and people returned to lives of peace…

Meanwhile, Idaten sensed disturbances again in the Builder Star System and went alone to investigate.

His last known location was on Planet Builder! Upon hearing this, Benten dispatched two heroes, Adon and Samson, to search for Idaten and investigate the strange happenings on Planet Builder.

item.title: Chill with You: Lo-Fi Story launches November 17
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Nestopi-developed sound novel dated.

Chill with You: Lo-Fi Story will launch for PC via Steam on November 17, developer Nestopi announced. It is a sound novel where you work alongside Satone, a girl who loves writing stories, and develop a special connection with her. It supports English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Chill with You: Lo-Fi Story is a work-focused sound novel game where you work at your desk alongside Satone, an imaginative girl who loves writing novels. Customize the lo-fi music, ambient sounds, and scenery that reflect Satone’s emotions to enhance your focus! The more time you spend working together, the deeper your bond will grow—perhaps you’ll even connect with Satone on a deeper level…?

Key Features

  • Emotionally Expressive Music to Maximize Focus – Whether you want to relax and work at a leisurely pace or boost your motivation with emotionally engaging melodies, Chill Talk offers a variety of original songs tailored for different work scenarios. Immerse yourself in deep focus while listening to high-quality music from talented sound artists.
  • A Wide Variety of Nature Sounds to Awaken Your Instincts – Sometimes, it’s best to turn off the music and listen to the soothing sounds of nature. Let the sound of wind, rain, and other natural elements sharpen your senses and create a deeply immersive work environment.
    Customize the ambient sounds to suit your preferences.
  • Pomodoro Timer for Maximum Productivity – Set up a Pomodoro timer before you start working to manage your break times effectively. Taking short, regular breaks helps maintain maximum concentration and efficiency.
  • Satone’s Hidden Feelings – During your break, take time to interact with Satone. The “precious moments” you share while working together will deepen your relationship, and if you build enough trust, she may eventually open her heart to you.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Kowloon’s Gate: Suzaku for Switch physical edition crowdfunding campaign launches November 11
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Switch version to feature enhanced graphics, new locations, and additional quests.

JETMAN has officially announced the Switch version of Kowloon’s Gate: Suzaku, which was first confirmed back in December 2019, and will launch a Campfire crowdfunding campaign for the limited physical release on November 11.

Kowloon’s Gate: Suzaku is based on Kowloon’s Gate VR: Suzaku, which was released for PlayStation VR on October 26, 2017 in Japan, followed by PlayStation 4 (flatscreen) via a free update on December 21, 2017.

The Switch version, which drops “VR” from the title, will feature enhanced graphics, new locations, and additional quests, including an event that ties into the story of the 1997-released PlayStation game Kowloon’s Gate.

According to the crowdfunding campaign description, JETMAN hopes to use the experience gained from the Switch release to remaster the original Kowloon’s Gate next, describing the campaign as the first step toward that goal.

item.title: The End of History launches in Early Access on December 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Strategy RPG to remain in Early Access for six months to one year.

Medieval sandbox strategy RPG The End of History will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on December 10 for $28 / 2,800 yen, publisher WorldMap and NOSTALGIC TRAIN developer Tatamibeya announced. A demo is currently available.

Here are the latest details:

Why We Chose to Release in Early Access

While many players enjoyed the demo, it also helped us identify a number of areas for improvement, such as overall usability and control feel.

After carefully evaluating the situation, we concluded that launching the game in Early Access—where we can continue to refine it step by step based on player feedback—would be the best approach.

The main feedback we received included:

  • Requests to improve combat responsiveness and pacing.
  • Comments on tutorial and user interface clarity.
  • Requests for controller support.
  • Suggestions for expanding role-playing options and rebalancing.

Development Roadmap

Development will proceed in two phases: work leading up to the Early Access release, and updates following its launch.

  • Work Planned Before Early Access Release
    • Combat Controls and Pacing Improvements – We’re refining combat feel and enemy AI behavior to make battles smoother and more strategic, reducing sources of frustration.
    • User Interface Improvements Centered on Dialogue Flow – We’ve revisited the tutorial and eliminated elements that interrupted play, creating a smoother and more intuitive experience.
    • Game Balance Adjustments – We’re reworking mechanics that made the early game disproportionately easy and fine-tuning overall balance.
    • New Feature Additions – We’re adding several systems that were not available in the demo, including:
      • Access to Sandbox Mode from the beginning of the game
      • A new “Found a Nation” path for independent factions
      • Romance interactions with NPCs
  • Work Planned After Early Access Release
    • Major User Interface Overhaul – The current interface is designed primarily for mouse input. We plan a large-scale redesign to support controller play and make the UI more intuitive overall.
    • Controller Support Implementation – Controller functionality will be added alongside the UI update.
    • Ongoing Improvements Based on Community Feedback – Even after launch, we’ll continue refining the game together with the community.

Please note that while controller support is one of the most requested features, it requires careful testing and rework, so implementation will take some additional time.

Early Access Details

  • Release Date: December 10, 2025 (planned)
  • Early Access Duration: Approximately six months to one year
  • Price: $28 (a launch discount is also planned)

About Combat

In The End of History, combat emphasizes tactical formation commands and coordinated maneuvers that allow you to flank enemy armies and gain the upper hand.

While many players shared feedback on control feel and pacing during the demo period, we’ve been addressing these issues for the Early Access version to make battles smoother and more enjoyable.

We’ll continue to refine combat based on player feedback to deliver an even more polished tactical experience.

And here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A strategy RPG where you live freely in a vast medieval feudal-simulated sandbox. Listen to the requests of the citizens, trade, plunder, serve, own a territory as a noble, usurp the throne, endless wars, and betrayal. The intertwining of your and numerous NPCs’ intentions creates unique stories.

The End of History is a sandbox-style strategy RPG set in a medieval-inspired world. As the protagonist, you leave your foster parent’s home one day and embark on a journey as an unknown wanderer. In a world where the motives of numerous NPCs intertwine, and cooperation and betrayal collide, you become a part of this world and can live freely as you choose.

Stop the Collapse of the World

Your mission is singular: to stop the collapse of the world. The world is heading towards destruction fueled by rising hatred and division. Every action has consequences, and you must observe their effects carefully.

Live Freely

From being a nameless entity to becoming a thief, trader, knight, or even a king, your existence in the world is up to you. Your choices shape your destiny.

“Obelisk” Mystery

This massive and mysterious structure holds the wisdom of a seemingly infinite world. Its existence is now shrouded in mystery, with fragments scattered across the world to piece together its secrets.

A Unique Story

This is not a heroic tale, but a record of historical observation.

The aftermath of battles, the words exchanged, the small, forgotten choices—all of these stir emotions and change actions. NPCs will continue to live their lives without you.

However, your decisions create ripples in their stories.

This game does not depict a predetermined scenario, but a unique and unrepeatable history born from the player’s involvement.

item.title: Dispatch sales top one million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Milestone achieved in 10 days.

Total sales for superhero workplace comedy game Dispatch have surpassed one million units in 10 days, developer AdHoc Studio announced.

Dispatch launched for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on October 22.

The $29.99 episodic game launched with Episodes 1 and 2, with additional episodes releasing weekly as free updates. Episodes 5 and 6 will launch on November 5, followed by the final two, Episodes 7 and 8, on November 12.
